intro: Chrysanthemum biebersteinianum, commonly known as the German chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow to orange petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. It blooms in late summer to early autumn, producing clusters of small, showy flowers that attract pollinators. This species is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
